impact-statement: NCOA4, the ferritin autophagy receptor, is regulated by HERC2 in an iron-dependent manner and is critical for red blood cell development.

equal-contrib.equal-contrib: These authors contributed equally to this work

contribution.con1: JDM, JDM, LPV, ACK, and JWH conceived the experiments. JDM and LPV performed all experiments except for zebrafish studies in Figure 5. SN, AJK, and WG performed zebrafish related experiments in Figure 5. DEB, XW, and YL provided technical support for mutagenesis, sequencing of CRISPR clones, cell line generation, and quantitative RT-PCR. JDM, LPV, ACK, and JWH wrote the manuscript, and all authors edited the manuscript
